ingredients: 500g chicken (bone-in or boneless), 2 onions (finely chopped), 2 tomatoes (chopped), 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 2-3 green chilies (slit), 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp garam masala, 1 tbsp coriander powder, 2 tbsp oil,1 tbsp fennel seed, 1 tbsp cumin seeds, 1 tbsp coriander seeds, 1 tsp black peppercorns, 2-3 dried red chilies, 4-5 cloves, 1-inch cinnamon stick, 2-3 green cardamoms, 2 tbsp grated coconut, Salt to taste.
instructions: Dry roast the Chettinad masala ingredients (except coconut) in a pan until fragrant. Add grated coconut and roast for another minute. Cool and grind to a fine powder.
Heat oil in a pan, add chopped onions, and saut√© until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, and chicken. Cook until the chicken changes color.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until the oil separates.
Add the prepared Chettinad masala, mix well, and cook for 5-7 minutes.  Add 1 cup of water, cover, and simmer until the chicken is tender.
Sprinkle garam masala, garnish with fresh curry leaves, and serve hot with rice or roti.
